item.title: Comment on The polity that is Russia by cliff arroyo
item.description:
Using the words 'traditional values' unironically in terms of modern russia is indicative of not understanding anything about the place.
Drug addiction, intimate partner violence and single parenthood are all off the charts.
The fact is that on top of russia's terrible demographics the tsar's mad decision to invade Ukraine has either killed off or driven away (probably permanently) a significant portion of breeding age males.
So.... this being russia, the solution is authoritarian with no understanding of human motivations.
Romania tried the same tactic in the 1980s and the results were.... not delightful.

item.title: Comment on The polity that is Russia by Ricardo
item.description:
Reply to So Much For Subtlety:

Using the words 'traditional values' unironically in terms of modern russia is indicative of not understanding anything about the place. Drug addiction, intimate partner violence and single parenthood are all off the charts.

So 70 years of highly Westernized elites trying to destroy traditional Russia and traditional Russian Christian values hasn't worked out so well, has it?

Perhaps the Russians might like to try something else.

They do not have to look to Romania. Stalin all but banned divorce, abortion and contraception after 1936. They were gradually allowed back after his death.

Good for the Russian Parliament. The West should also reject the culture of death

Putin has been working hard over the past 15 years to convince foreigners that Russia is the last bastion of traditional Christian values. Evidently, it is working on some people.

Notably absent is any talk of beating swords into ploughshares.
